Method Detail

getXmlQuery

public static java.lang.String getXmlQuery(java.util.List<QueryOptionModel> queryModels,
                                           QueryOptionModel simModel,
                                           java.lang.String conjunction)
Constructs the overall xml query string to post to the PDB Advanced Search web service. The query models are first combined with the specified conjunction (AND or OR) The composite query from the first step is then combined with the similarity query (always using an AND conjunction).

Parameters:
queryModels - the query models
simModel - the similarity query model
conjunction - the conjunction type
Returns:
the xml query string

getXmlQuery

public static java.lang.String getXmlQuery(java.lang.String initialQuery,
                                           java.util.List<QueryOptionModel> queryModels,
                                           java.lang.String conjunction)
Constructs a partial xml query string from a list of query models and a conjunction operator. The return string is preseeded with an optional initial query string.

Parameters:
initialQuery - the initial query
queryModels - the query models
conjunction - the conjunction (used only if there is more than one query model)
Returns:
the xml query string

getDataType

public static org.knime.core.data.DataType getDataType(ReportField field)
Gets the KNIME data type for a given ReportField type. Performs dynamic check that Smiles support is available in KNIME. If so, SMILES report fields are returned as Smiles DataType, else returned as StringCell DataType.

Parameters:
field - the report field
Returns:
the KNIME data type

getDataCell

public static org.knime.core.data.DataCell getDataCell(ReportField field,
                                                       java.lang.String fieldValue,
                                                       java.lang.String urlSuffix)
                                                throws java.lang.Exception
Gets the KNIME data cell for a given report field value. If field or field value is null or empty, returns MissingCell. Else attempts to convert the field value string to the appropriately typed data cell value.

Parameters:
field - the report field
fieldValue - the field value (as a string)
urlSuffix - the url suffix (for PNG_URL fields only)
Returns:
the KNIME data cell
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if field value is invalid

postQuery

public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> postQuery(java.lang.String xml)
                                                  throws java.io.IOException
Posts an XML query string to the PDB Advanced Search RESTful web service.

Parameters:
xml - the xml query string to post
Returns:
the result as a list of strings, one per line of output
Throws:
java.io.IOException - Signals that an I/O exception has occurred.

getCustomReportCsv

public static java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> getCustomReportCsv(java.util.List<java.lang.String> pdbIds,
                                                                                  java.util.List<ReportField> selected)
                                                                           throws java.lang.Exception
Deprecated. 

Gets the custom report in CSV format from the PDB Custom Report RESTful web service. The custom report is returned as a list of list of field values, where the inner list represents a single report row (one PDB ID), and the outer list represents all PDB IDs.

WARNING: This method is unsafe as it does not deal correctly with field values containing quote characters. Use getCustomReportXml2 instead.

Parameters:
pdbIds - the list of PDB IDs to generate report for
selected - the selected report fields to include in the report
Returns:
the custom report
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - the exception
See Also:
getCustomReportXml2(List, List)

getCustomReportXml

public static java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> getCustomReportXml(java.util.List<java.lang.String> pdbIds,
                                                                                  java.util.List<ReportField> selected)
                                                                           throws java.lang.Exception
Deprecated. 

Gets the custom report in XML format from the PDB Custom Report RESTful web service. The custom report is returned as a list of list of field values, where the inner list represents a single report row (one PDB ID), and the outer list represents all PDB IDs.

WARNING: This method, although robust, can be memory intensive as it uses the heavy-duty JDOM DocumentBuilder to parse the XML output. Use getCustomReportXml2 instead.

Parameters:
pdbIds - the list of PDB IDs to generate report for
selected - the selected report fields to include in the report
Returns:
the custom report
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - the exception
See Also:
getCustomReportXml2(List, List)

getCustomReportXml2

public static java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> getCustomReportXml2(java.util.List<java.lang.String> pdbIds,
                                                                                   java.util.List<ReportField> selected)
                                                                            throws java.lang.Exception
Gets the custom report in XML format from the PDB Custom Report RESTful web service. The custom report is returned as a list of list of field values, where the inner list represents a single report row (one PDB ID), and the outer list represents all PDB IDs.

Note: this is the preferred PDB custom report parser at present. It uses a crude, bespoke parser that assumes:

  1. there is one XML element per line
  2. fixed XML element names for root, dataset and record elements (as defined in PdbConnectorConfig)
  3. all other XML elements are field values

WARNING: This code is vulnerable to any change in the PDB Custom Report output format.

Parameters:
pdbIds - the list of PDB IDs to generate report for
selected - the selected report fields to include in the report
Returns:
the custom report
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - the exception

getPdbIdUrl

Gets the URL string that represents a list of PDB IDs.

Parameters:
pdbIds - the list of PDB IDs
Returns:
the URL string (comma-separated values)

the URL string (comma-separated values)
